questions.text: Welcome to SQL Island Survival! Your plane has crash-landed on a mysterious island. The first step is to understand how to navigate the game interface. Click the 'Quiz' button in the header menu to load the quiz section.
To ensure you can understand and use the information provided in the game, you need to know where to find the guide section. Click the 'Guide' button in the header menu to access the guide section.

The quiz section helps you learn SQL through interactive questions. To answer a question, you'll need to arrange SQL keywords in the correct order. Drag and drop the keywords into the droppable boxes.
answers: Drag and drop the keywords into the droppable boxes
correctSequence: Drag and drop the keywords into the droppable boxes

questions.text: In some questions, you'll need to select the correct SQL statement from multiple choices. Click on the answer choice to select it.
To navigate through different questions, use the 'Next Question' button to move to the next question.
If you need to restart the quiz from the beginning, click the 'Restart Quiz' button.
Sometimes, you may want to navigate to a specific question. Enter the question number in the input box and click 'Go to Question'.
answers: Enter the question number in the input box and click 'Go to Question'
correctSequence: Enter the question number in the input box and click 'Go to Question'

questions.text: In case you make a mistake in arranging the keywords or selecting an answer, click the 'Reset Level' button to reset the current level.
To load different sets of questions, there are buttons labeled for different JSON files. Click the 'Load Tutorial' button to load the 'tutorial.json' file.
To load the main set of quiz questions, click the 'Load Questions' button.
If you want to learn some basic SQL concepts, click the 'Load Basics' button to load the 'basics.json' file.

The progress of your quiz is saved automatically using local storage. Each JSON file has its own separate progress, so you can switch between tutorials, questions, and basics without losing your place.
answers: Progress for each JSON file is stored separately using local storage
correctSequence: Progress for each JSON file is stored separately using local storage
